entry.title: Coinbase Shares Up 6% Since Unveiling Layer-2 Ethereum Network Base
entry.summary: The exchange’s Ethereum Layer-2 network is aimed at courting developers of decentralized applications.

entry.title: Orange Comet Raises Over $7 Million in New Funding for NFT Media Play
entry.summary: The digital entertainment platform plans to expand its already notable offerings.

entry.title: Orange Comet CEO: 'We're Trying to Build the Disney of Web3'
entry.summary: Dave Broome, CEO of NFT design and production studio Orange Comet, spoke to Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how his company takes "large, popular IP" and turns it into NFT content and Web3 worlds around it.

entry.title: How Much Wash Trading Is Really Happening on Blur?
entry.summary: A leading NFT analytics platform has flagged 80% of recent trades on Blur as “inorganic,” but is it really wash trading?

entry.title: Visa Says It's Not Slowing Down Plans for Crypto Products
entry.summary: The payments giant still wants to grow its digital asset department, according to the company's head of crypto.

entry.title: Game Engine Unity Adds Verified Web3 Toolbox for MetaMask, Solana, Dapper Labs
entry.summary: The 3D gaming tech company is highlighting Web3 tools for its massive game developer community.

entry.title: Former FTX Director Pleads Guilty to Fraud—SEC, CFTC File Civil Charges
entry.summary: Nishad Singh is the latest high-level employee at FTX to plead guilty to criminal charges.

entry.title: Ledger Stax Hands-On Review: A Hardware Wallet With iPod Design Flourishes
entry.summary: Decrypt spent some quality time with Ledger’s new crypto hardware wallet at NFT Paris. Here are our first impressions.

entry.title: Ex-Goldman Sachs Analyst Releases Kill-to-Earn Zombie Game 'Undead Blocks' on ImmutableX
entry.summary: Billed as Mario Kart meets Call of Duty Zombies, “Undead Blocks” is a cross-platform shoot-em-up with guns as NFTs.

entry.title: Worldwide Web Founder: What NFT Gaming 'Should Be and Will Be'
entry.summary: Worldwide Webb is a gaming realm that lets you turn your NFT PFPs (Punks, Apes, Doodles and so on) into playable avatars. Founder Thomas Webb spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about how the game works, the $10m Series A funding it just received, and why he expects we'll soon see NFT games that show what NFT gaming can do in its best form.

entry.title: Algorand Wallet MyAlgo Urges Users to Withdraw Funds After $9.2M Exploit
entry.summary: The Algorand Foundation’s CTO said the exploit was “not the result of an underlying issue with the Algorand protocol or SDK.”

entry.title: Ex-Electronic Arts, Sony Game Developers Raise $13 Million For 'Avalon' Digital Universe
entry.summary: “Avalon” aims to be a AAA interoperable gameworld with blockchain elements.

entry.title: NFT Games 'Aren't Just About Minting': WorldWide Webb Founder
entry.summary: The gaming community hasn't shown much affection for NFTs, but the Worldwide Webb founder thinks that could soon change.

entry.title: Term Labs Raises $2.5M to Build Out Fixed-Rate Product for DeFi
entry.summary: Term Labs is building out a key primitive for the DeFi space, allowing crypto projects to lock in fixed rates on their idle holdings.

entry.title: Ethereum Edges Closer to Letting Users Withdraw Staked ETH
entry.summary: Sepolia is the second Ethereum testnet to see a dress rehearsal for Shanghai, which will finally let users withdraw their staked ETH.

entry.title: TeraWulf’s Nuclear Bitcoin Plant Is Just One Piece of the Green Mining Puzzle
entry.summary: Terawulf’s newest nuclear-powered Bitcoin miner in Pennsylvania isn’t the firm’s first attempt at going green.

entry.title: Bitcoin NFT Mints Surpass 200K—But Is Interest in Ordinals Fading?
entry.summary: Miner fees have tanked from $170K to $11K in less than two weeks—but a new Yuga Labs project may rekindle things.

entry.title: Yat Siu of Animoca Brands: 'The Future of Crypto and Web3 Is Culture'
entry.summary: Animoca Brands chairman Yat Siu spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about the open metaverse, NFTs and gaming, building through a bear market, and why Animoca believes the future of the industry is culture and gaming.

entry.title: COO of Move-to-Earn App STEPN: 'We're Thriving, Not Just Surviving'
entry.summary: Shiti Manghani, COO of Stepn, the app that lets users earn tokens for exercising, spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about Stepn's current health, its plans to addnew achievement systems for the top users, and parent company Finding Satoshi Labs and its plans to launch more apps.

entry.title: Bored Ape Yacht Club Creator Yuga Labs Reveals First Bitcoin NFT Project
entry.summary: TwelveFold, a limited series of just 300 generative Ordinals NFT art pieces on Bitcoin, will be auctioned later this week.

entry.title: Robinhood Faces SEC Investigation Over Crypto Business
entry.summary: The SEC hit Robinhood with a subpoena in December regarding the company's crypto listings and custody of assets, the firm disclosed today.

entry.title: Winning ‘Dookey Dash’ Key NFT Sells to Billionaire for $1.63 Million in Ethereum
entry.summary: “Fortnite” esports star Mongraal has accepted a 1,000 ETH bid for his NFT after achieving the highest score on Yuga Labs’ game.

entry.title: Gamers Will Drive Web3 Adoption: Polygon Labs President Ryan Wyatt
entry.summary: Despite the NFT backlash, the ex-YouTube Gaming head believes that gamers will eventually embrace Web3.

entry.title: Ethereum Gas Fees Are Slowly Climbing as NFT Market Rebounds
entry.summary: The breakout success of the Blur marketplace and a new Yuga Labs title are likely moving the needle.

entry.title: Solana Foundation Still Doesn’t Know What Caused Weekend Network Outage
entry.summary: Two days after a major outage, the Solana Foundation says it’s still investigating why the network went down for almost 20 hours.

entry.title: Coinbase to Delist Binance USD Stablecoin Amid Regulatory Scrutiny
entry.summary: The announcement comes weeks after Paxos disclosed regulatory trouble that centered around the Binance-branded stablecoin.

entry.title: NFT Royalties Are 'Not Going Away on SuperRare': Co-Founder Jon Perkins
entry.summary: The NFT space is a much bigger picture than just the recent Blur versus OpenSea controversy, according to SuperRare founder Jonathan Perkins.

entry.title: Playboy Expects to Launch MetaMansion Virtual World This Year
entry.summary: Access to the MetaMansion will be open to users without a Rabbitar, but they won't be able to access all the “cool places" in the virtual world.

entry.title: Ethereum Developers to Let Goerli Testnet ‘Slowly Die’ as Coin Price Soars
entry.summary: With the Goerli’s native coin becoming the target of rampant speculation, one Ethereum developer said it’s time to pack it in.

entry.title: Banning Crypto 'Should Not Be Taken Off The Table': IMF
entry.summary: The IMF wants to see more regulation of digital assets, but still says there could even be an outright ban on cryptocurrencies.

entry.title: Maximizing Profits Will ‘Kill’ Web3: Animoca Brands Chairman
entry.summary: Yat Siu described royalties as the gas that keep an economy of creators humming.

entry.title: Alchemy Launches Dapp Builder for the Next Billion Web3 Developers
entry.summary: The blockchain developer says its new tool can spin up decentralized applications in 4 minutes.

entry.title: Sam Bankman-Fried Did ‘Immeasurable’ Damage to Crypto Industry: Ava Labs CEO
entry.summary: Emin Gün Sirer said Sam Bankman-Fried’s alleged fraud tarnished the crypto industry’s goodwill.

entry.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: NFT Community Wants Creator Royalties Back
entry.summary: Plus several people tweeted their concern that upstart NFT marketplace Blur is currently dominated by a handful of pro traders.

entry.title: CoinFLEX Claims Blockchain.com Owes Over $4.3M in FLEX
entry.summary: Blockchain.com says the claim is “completely meritless and a work of fiction.”

entry.title: Crypto Terms Are 'in a Lot of Ways Poisoned' Says Artist Tom Sachs
entry.summary: American sculptor Tom Sach said he is much more focused on pushing the limits of his creative process than the associations of Web3 terms.

entry.title: ‘Most Projects Are Not Going to Make It’ : Doodles CEO
entry.summary: With the industry reeling from last year's events, Doodles CEO Julian Holguin says events like NFT Paris can also be a much-needed refuge.

entry.title: Adidas to 'Scope Out' Token-Gated Sneaker Drops, Says Web3 Lead
entry.summary: Adidas' Web3 lead hinted at unique ways to integrate crypto beyond simply adding a payments option. Instead, it's all about community.

entry.title: Don’t Call It ‘Crypto’: How Some Blockchain and NFT Projects are Rebranding
entry.summary: As the bear market bites, crypto projects are abandoning terms like NFTs and Web3. Here's how branding experts think they should weather the storm.

entry.title: Borrowing Against a Bored Ape NFT—What Could Go Wrong?
entry.summary: With the rise of non-fungible tokens, many users are now looking for more ways to "unlock" liquidity for their Apes, Penguins, and Doodles.

entry.title: This Week in Coins: Bitcoin, Ethereum Dip as Crypto Market Sheds $58B
entry.summary: Crypto appears to be shedding much of its new year gains, with Bitcoin and Ethereum each posting hefty losses on the week.

entry.title: NBA Top Shot Lawsuit May Be Bad For Dapper—Could It Be Good for NFTs?
entry.summary: A federal judge’s ruling has offered a first glimpse at how the U.S. government might seek to regulate NFTs. And it may not be all bad, legal experts say.

entry.title: Winning Key on Yuga Labs Dookey Dash Gets $1.1M Bid on OpenSea
entry.summary: The holder of the winning Dookey Dash key, 18-year-old Fortnite streamer Mongraal, is currently trying to sell it for $3.5 million.

entry.title: Bitcoin Dips After Key Inflation Indicator Rattles Market
entry.summary: The entire crypto market is in the red today as investors shift risk once again.

entry.title: gm: Ryan Wyatt on Polygon’s Winning Streak
entry.summary: Polygon Labs President Ryan Wyatt, the former YouTube Gaming head, helped turn Polygon into one of the crypto industry’s rare winners in 2022. In a lively chat with Dan Roberts and Andrew Hayward, he revealed why the promise of digital ownership pushed him from the gaming world into crypto, and how Polygon has pulled giants like Starbucks, Reddit, and Instagram into Web3. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: NFT Paris Founder Alexandre Tsydenkov Previews 2023 Event
entry.summary: NFTs take over Paris on February 23. Decrypt's Stephen Graves interviews NFT Paris founder Alexandre Tsydenkov about this year's conference, which features speakers from many of the top collections and companies in the space, plus lots of side events. Decrypt will be on hand as a media partner, conducting interviews and moderating panels. See you in France!

entry.title: 'Words with Friends' Creator Paul Bettner: Web3 Can Solve Twitch's Limitations
entry.summary: Paul Bettner tells Decrypt about the challenges he faced while developing his Web3 game "Wildcard."

entry.title: 'Words with Friends' Creator Paul Bettner on Why He's Building His Next Game 'Wildcard' in Web3
entry.summary: Paul Bettner shares his perspective on Web3 gaming platforms and his vision to make games everywhere and anywhere players want them.

entry.title: gm Week in Review: SEC Targets Staking, a16z Doesn’t Get Its Way, NFTs Popping
entry.summary: In our February 11, 2023 week in review episode, Matthew Diemer, Stacy Elliott, and Stephen Graves talk about the latest developments in the FTX case, 3AC founders trying for a comeback, a16z losing on a big Uniswap vote despite holding 15 million UNI tokens, and NFTs roaring back with CryptoPunks, Bored Apes, and Ordinals NFTs selling hot. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Bill Murray Discusses NFT Project, First Members-Only Event
entry.summary: Comedic legend Bill Murray sits down with Decrypt at his first exclusive party for NFT holders in Oceanside, California. He describes the project’s origins and why it didn’t feel “mercenary” for him to create an NFT-based membership club.

entry.title: gm: Kristin Smith and the Crypto Crusade in Washington
entry.summary: Kristin Smith is Executive Director of the Blockchain Association, which advocates for crypto policy in Washington D.C.—an exhausting effort that Sam Bankman-Fried was closely involved in, until he set it all on fire. Kristin tells Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott how SBF and FTX set things back, but there are still positive signs from crypto friendly voices in Congress. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
